Types of Cases Eligible for CO Guidance
The types of individual cases eligible for CO guidance are limited to the following issues:
a matter of program policy or procedure
the applicability of
a provision in the regulations
the rating schedule, or
other CO directives, such advisory opinions and instructions contained in M21-1
the propriety of establishing service connection, other than a question involving the evaluation of evidence
when rating schedule provisions are not adequate for evaluation
a proposed rating or authorization action involving a difference of opinion with a prior rating or other action based on the same set of facts (per
38 CFR 3.105(b)
), and
a rating under
38 CFR 3.105(a)
awarding monetary benefits for a retroactive period of more than five years.
Note
:Â  Following a 2009 decision by the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit, ROs are no longer required to submit pending awards of benefits to CO for review and approval (prior to final award action) for cases involving
payments equal to or exceeding $250,000, or
an effective date that is eight or more years in the past.
